page.title: 12ST.MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: There has been a church on the site of St.Michael's and All Angels',Tettenhall for over 1000 years.The huge,old yew trees in the churchyard are perhaps the only remains of the first church.The tower is about 600 years old but the main part of the church is only 30 years old.The church had to be rebuilt after a fire in 1950.The church opened again in 1955.In 1985 the sanctuary was changed.The altar has been placed in the centre of the sanctuary. The churchyard has many old graves but work is going on,flattening the stones, laying grass for easy maintenance. The church has a staff of 6 people led by the Rector.Every Sunday there is a Family Communion Service.Men,boys and girls sing in the choirs.There are special services at Christmas and Easter.There are about 100 weddings,80 funerals and 80 christenings each year.
